subject: Math
title: Standard Form of Quadratics
description: Understanding and working with the standard form ax² + bx + c

content.text: The standard form of a quadratic function is f(x) = ax² + bx + c. This form makes it easy to identify the y-intercept and determine the direction the parabola opens.

content.heading: Standard Form: f(x) = ax² + bx + c
content.text:
• a is the leading coefficient (must not be zero)
• b is the linear coefficient
• c is the constant term (y-intercept)
• The graph is a parabola

content.heading: Example 2
content.problem: Write a quadratic with a = 3, b = -2, c = 5
solution: Substitute into standard form: f(x) = ax² + bx + c
